claims: BIGGEST TIP: Follow Lauren Bongiorno with Risely - she is on IG and has a very informative podcast. She's a beast for workouts so she really knows a lot, and almost NEVER drops in extended aerobic workout

Anaerobic workout requiring muscular bursts (weight training, HIIT, etc) will create stress, this a release of muscle energy from the body, glucagon, to fuel those muscles. That generally makes our b.s. rise.
Very little/ no insulin on board should help.
DEF eat complex carbs and some fat before workout.
Also be ready for the later hypo that can happen a few hours after exercise but usually a nice carby meal takes care of that
Some gastroenterologists will give you a diagnosis based on blood test results alone if you meet a certain threshold.
My sonâs GE offered a diagnosis without the scope because his numbers were through the roof but we opted for the scope in case it ever precluded him
The celiac test gives false positives sometimes, but no false negatives.
Below 7 is the goal but my doc really had no issues with under 7.5

Highly recommend https://www.yourdiabetesinsider.com/ I recently started seeing one of their dietitians and they gave some great recommendations on this (I wonât share here because I am not a qualified dietician or diabetes educator).

This is typically caused by insulin still in your body with basal and any bolus from meals in the last 4 hours.
